bug.short_desc: Generator doesn't allow using complex environment values on JS-code at build time.

long_desc.thetext:
So far, supported environment values are only scalars (number, string, boolean, ...) and lists of such [1]. Maps are currently not supported.
As a workaround you can flatten the map out to
"environment" : { "build.integration.platform" : "XXX", "build.integration.bootstrap": ["A", "B", "C"], ...
But mind that lists have special meaning here, in that they trigger variant generation [2].
> To prevent this error just refer qx.core.Environment to a local variable on the > JS-script.
If you mean something like
var e = qx.core.Environment; e.get("build.integration")
then, yes, this works around the issue which arises in the variant optimization during build generation. But it's currently illegal anyway, and the config shouldn't validate in the first place.
[1] http://manual.qooxdoo.org/3.0/pages/tool/generator/generator_config_ref.html#environment [2] http://manual.qooxdoo.org/3.0/pages/tool/generator/generator_config_articles.html#how-to-create-multiple-variants-in-one-go
